gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਖਾਂਡ ਖਾਂਡ ਕਹੈ ਮੁਖਿ ਨਹੀ ਮੀਠਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਜਬ ਲਗ ਜੀਭ ਸ੍ਵਾਦ ਖਾਂਡੁ ਨਹੀਂ ਖਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Khaand Khaand Kahai Moukhi Nahee Meetthaa Hoi , Jab Lag Jeebh Svaad Khaandu Naheen Khaaeeai ?
translation: Just as by saying sugar, sugar, one cannot feel sweet taste of sugar in the mouth. Unless sugar is placed on the tongue, it cannot feel its taste.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਰਾਤ ਅੰਧੇਰੀ ਮੈ ਦੀਪਕ ਦੀਪਕ ਕਹੈ ਤਿਮਰ ਨ ਜਾੲੀ ਜਬ ਲਗ ਨ ਜਰਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Raat Andhayree Mai Deepak Deepak Kahai , Timar N Jaaee Jab Lag N Jaraaeeai ?
translation: In a dark night, saying lamp, lamp does not dispel darkness unless lamp is lit.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਕਹੈ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਹੂੰ ਨ ਹੋਤ ਕਛੁ ਜਬ ਲਗੁ ਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਅੰਤਰਿ ਨ ਪਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Giaan Giaan Kahai Giaan Hoon N Hot Kachhu , Jab Lagu Gur Giaan Antari N Paaeeai ?
translation: Just by saying Gian (Knowledge) again and again, knowledge cannot be obtained. It can only be acquired by lodging His name in the heart.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਕਹੈ ਗੁਰ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਹੂ ਨ ਪਾਵਤ ਜਬ ਲਗੁ ਗੁਰ ਦਰਸ ਜਾੲਿ ਨ ਸਮਾੲੀਅੈ ||੫੪੨||
transliteration: Taisay Gur Dhiaan Kahai Gur Dhiaan Hoo N Paavata , Jab Lagu Gur Daras Jaai N Samaaeeai ?542?
translation: Similarly just repeatedly asking for a glimpse of True Guru, one cannot acquire contemplation of the True Guru. This is possible only when one engrosses oneself up to the soul in the ardent desire of a glimpse of the True Guru.  (542)
